content: that won t slip through the stitches or use black yarn to embroider eyes instead which would make the plush safer for all ages work in a spiral or slip_stitch to join at the end of each round based on your preference body round 1 create a magic_ring and work 12 single_crochet into the ring 12 round 2 2sc in first st single_crochet in next st *2sc in next st single_crochet in next st* repeat * * around 18 pattern continued round 3 2sc in first st single_crochet in next 2 sts *2sc in next st single_crochet in next 2 sts* repeat * * around 24 round 4 2sc in first st single_crochet in next 3 sts *2sc in next st single_crochet in next 3 sts* repeat * * around 30 round 5 2sc in first st single_crochet in next 4 *2sc in next single_crochet in next 4* repeat * around 36 round 6 2sc in first st single_crochet in next 5 *2sc in next single_crochet in next 5* repeat * around 42 round 7 2sc in first st single_crochet in next 6 *2sc in next single_crochet in next 6* repeat * around 48 round 8 - 14 single_crochet in each st around 48 round 15 *decrease single_crochet in next 6* repeat * 42 round 16 *decrease single_crochet in next 5* repeat * 36 pattern continued round 17 *decrease single_crochet in next 4* repeat * slip_stitch to first st to join 30 ch1 single_crochet in first st fo and leave several inches of a tail to be used later finishing fold the piece in half with the last single_crochet at one end this will be the tail end of the bird using a tapestry needle and the orange yarn begin embroidering a beak at the other end around a stitch between rounds 15 and 16 attach the eyes on either side of the beak using the tapestry needle and the finishing tail from the body whip stitch up the back in blo stuffing with fiber fill as you go leaving 3 sts unworked fo attach the red yarn in the next st over from where you fo the closure still working in blo to finish closing the piece 3sc in first st 3dc in next 3 single_crochet in last st fo hide all the ends squish as needed and enjoy
